desc: The state of the atmosphere at a particular place and time.
example: The weather today is sunny and warm.

desc: Water that falls from the sky in drops.
example: It started to rain in the afternoon.

desc: Frozen water that falls as white flakes from the sky.
example: We had a lot of snow last winter.

desc: Air moving from one place to another.
example: The wind blew the leaves off the trees.

desc: A thick cloud of tiny water droplets near the ground.
example: The fog made it hard to see the road.
It's too hot to go outside.
It gets very cold in the mountains.
It will be sunny tomorrow morning.
It was cloudy all day long.

desc: A period of violent weather including wind, rain, or thunder.
